docs.description:

If `sObjectName` is not specified, it will print the total number of all available sObjects and push the result to `state.data`.

docs.description:
Executes an SOQL (Salesforce Object Query Language) query to retrieve records from Salesforce.
Note that in an event of a query error, error logs will be printed but the operation will not throw the error.

The Salesforce query API is subject to rate limits, {@link https://sforce.co/3W9zyaQ learn more here}.

tags.title: example
tags.description: query('SELECT Id FROM Patient__c', { limit: Infinity });
tags.caption: Run a query and download all matching records

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Run a query and limit records

tags.title: example
tags.description: query(state => `SELECT Id FROM Patient__c WHERE Health_ID__c = '${state.data.healthId}'`);
tags.caption: Query patients by Health ID

tags.title: example
tags.description: query(`SELECT Id FROM Patient__c WHERE Health_ID__c = '${$.data.healthId}'`);
tags.caption: Query patients by Health ID using a lazy state reference

tags.title: param
tags.description: A SOQL query string. Must be less than 4000 characters in WHERE clause
tags.name: query

tags.title: param
tags.description: Maximum number of records to fetch. If `limit: Infinity` is passed, all records will be fetched.
tags.name: options.limit

tags.title: state
tags.description: {Object} response - An object of result metadata. { done, totalSize, nextRecordsUrl?: string } where nextRecordsUrl is only present when done is false

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from a JSON object.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

tags.title: param
tags.description: JSONPath referencing a point in given JSON object.
tags.name: path

docs.description:
Picks out a single value from source data.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.

Picks out a value from source data.
Will return whatever JSONPath returns, which will always be an array.
If you need a single value use `sourceValue` instead.
Ensures a path points at the data.

Picks out a single value from the source data object‚Äîusually `state.data`.
If a JSONPath returns more than one value for the reference, the first
item will be returned.
Ensures a path points at references.
Picks out the last reference value from source data.

Iterates over an array of items and invokes an operation upon each one, where the state
object is _scoped_ so that state.data is the item under iteration.
The rest of the state object is untouched and can be referenced as usual.
You can pass an array directly, or use lazy state or a JSONPath string to
reference a slice of state.

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Using lazy state ($) to iterate over items in state.data and pass each into an "insert" operation

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Iterate over items in state.data and pass each one into an "insert" operation

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Using JSON path to iterate over items in state.data and pass each one into an "insert" operation

tags.title: param
tags.description: The operation needed to be repeated.
tags.name: operation

docs.description:
Iterates over a collection of items and returns a new array of mapped values,
like Javascript's `Array.map()` function.

Each item in the source array will be passed into the callback function. The returned value
will be added to the new array. The callback is passed the original item, the current index
in the source array (ie, the nth item number), and the state object.

Writes a new array to `state.data` with transformed values.c array.

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Transform an array of items in state

tags.title: example
tags.caption: Map items asynchronously (e.g. fetch extra info)

tags.title: param
tags.description: An array of items or a a JSONPath string which points to an array of items.
tags.name: path

tags.title: param
tags.description: The mapping function, invoked with `(data, index, state)` for each item in the array.
tags.name: callback
